meanings.definition: Suggesting the presence of danger; threatening.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds in the sky looked menacing, hinting at a storm.
meanings.sent2: The growling dog gave a menacing stare to the stranger approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The menacing shadow of the tree made the squirrel think it was a giant monster.
meanings.sent4: The menacing tone in her voice made it clear she was not to be crossed.
meanings.sent5: The menacing figure in the horror movie haunted my dreams for days.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is likely to cause harm or danger.
meanings.sent1: The guard dog was a menacing presence at the entrance, keeping intruders away.
meanings.sent2: The dark alley was filled with menacing figures lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent3: The menacing storm clouds seemed to be plotting mischief in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The menacing of the bully made the other kids afraid to go to the playground.
meanings.sent5: The menacing of the villain in the story added suspense to the plot.
